meanings.definition: To assign degrees of urgency to (wounded or ill patients) in order to determine the order of treatment
meanings.sent1: The nurse was triaging the patients in the emergency room.
meanings.sent2: The doctors were triaging the injured people after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The hospital staff was triaging patients so efficiently that they felt like superheroes.
meanings.sent4: She was triaging the tasks on her to-do list like a skilled organizer.
meanings.sent5: The paramedic's quick triaging saved many lives during the disaster.

meanings.definition: To determine the priority of (items or tasks) based on their importance or urgency
meanings.sent1: The team was triaging the project tasks to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was triaging the homework assignments for grading.
meanings.sent3: The kids were triaging their toys to decide which ones to donate.
meanings.sent4: He was triaging his emails, responding to the most urgent ones first.
meanings.sent5: The manager was triaging the issues to address them in the correct order.
